paper_metadata.title: Early intervention with tafamidis provides long-term (5.5-year) delay of neurologic progression in transthyretin hereditary amyloid polyneuropathy
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant TTRV30M, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Median age at disease onset was 32.0 (22–65) years.
patients.phenotype: ATTR-FAP characterized by amyloid deposition in the peripheral nervous system.

functional_data.summary: The TTRV30M variant is associated with ATTR-FAP, leading to neurologic impairment.

variants.segregation_data: The TTRV30M variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study focuses on patients with early-stage ATTR-FAP due to the TTRV30M mutation.
key_quotes: Of more than 100 different TTR mutations linked to ATTR-FAP, the most common variant is the TTRV30M mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one variant in the TTR gene was reported in the paper.
